fetch: This element controls how rows from a result set will be returned. Legal values include PDO::FETCH_ASSOC, PDO::FETCH_BOTH, PDO::FETCH_OBJ, PDO::FETCH_NUM, or a string representing the name of a class. If a string is specified, each record will be fetched into a new object of that class. The behavior of all other values is defined by PDO. See http://php.net/manual/pdostatement.fetch.php
field: Field name (required for column sorting).
field: The database field represented in the table column (required if user is to be able to sort on this column).

file: (optional) A filename to add to 'includes', either prefixed with the value of 'path', or the path of the extension implementing hook_theme().

file: Path to the file containing the definitions of the 'operations' and 'finished' functions, for instance if they don't reside in the main .module file. The path should be relative to base_path(), and thus should be built using drupal_get_path().
file: The file the implementation resides in. This file will be included prior to the theme being rendered, to make sure that the function or preprocess function (as needed) is actually loaded.
filename: The filepath and name of the .info.yml file.

files: An optional array defining include files that need to be loaded for building the form. Each array entry may be the path to a file or another array containing values for the parameters 'type', 'module' and 'name' as needed by module_load_include(). The files listed here are automatically loaded by \Drupal::formBuilder()->getCache(). By default the current menu router item's 'file' definition is added, if any. Use self::loadInclude() to add include files from a form constructor.

finished: Name of an implementation of callback_batch_finished(). This is executed after the batch has completed. This should be used to perform any result massaging that may be needed, and possibly save data in $_SESSION for display after final page redirection.
first: Item for the first page; not present on the first page of results.
first_new: '1' when this is the first topic with new posts, otherwise '0'.
first_new: Indicates whether this is the first topic with new posts.

fixed: A fixed array of language negotiation method identifiers to use to initialize this language. If locked is set to TRUE and fixed is set, it will always use the specified methods in the given priority order. If not present and locked is TRUE then language-interface will be used.

immutable: If this flag is set to TRUE, a new form build id is generated when the form is loaded from the cache. If it is subsequently saved to the cache again, it will have another cache id and therefore the original form and form-state will remain unaltered. This is important when page caching is enabled in order to prevent form state from leaking between anonymous users.

int $min_wordsafe_length: If $wordsafe is TRUE, the minimum acceptable length for truncation (before adding an ellipsis, if $add_ellipsis is TRUE). Has no effect if $wordsafe is FALSE. This can be used to prevent having a very short resulting string that will not be understandable. For instance, if you are truncating the string "See myverylongurlexample.com for more information" to a word-safe return length of 20, the only available word boundary within 20 characters is after the word "See", which wouldn't leave a very informative string. If you had set $min_wordsafe_length to 10, though, the function would realise that "See" alone is too short, and would then just truncate ignoring word boundaries, giving you "See myverylongurl..." (assuming you had set $add_ellipses to TRUE).

Modules may add this key to grant different access to different translations of a node, such that (e.g.) a particular group is granted access to edit the Catalan version of the node, but not the Hungarian version. needs-data: The type of data that must be provided to \Drupal\Core\Utility\Token::replace() in the $data argument (i.e., the key name in $data) in order for tokens of this type to be used in the $text being processed. For instance, if the token needs a node object, 'needs-data' should be 'node', and to use this token in \Drupal\Core\Utility\Token::replace(), the caller needs to supply a node object as $data['node']. Some token data can also be supplied indirectly; for instance, a node object in $data supplies a user object (the author of the node), allowing user tokens to be used when only a node data object is supplied.

object[] $wildcards: An array object candidates tried on every parameter regardless of its name.
object|null $object The currently validated object:
object|string $objectOrClass The object or its class name:
old_topics: A count of posts that have already been read.
operation: The name of the operation indicating the context where language fallback is being applied. The following operations are defined in core, but more may be defined in contributed modules:
operation: The operation to be performed (string).
operations: (required) Array of operations to be performed, where each item is an array consisting of the name of an implementation of callback_batch_operation() and an array of parameter. Example:
operations: A list of operation links, e.g., Settings, Enable, Disable, etc. these links should only be displayed if the theme is compatible.
operator: The operators for how the filters value should be treated.
optional: A checkbox to require this filter or not.
options: (optional) An array of options to be passed to \Drupal\Core\Utility\LinkGeneratorInterface::generate() when generating a link from this menu item.
options: An array of options. Each option contains:

options: An associative array of additional options that will be passed to either \Drupal\Core\Utility\UnroutedUrlAssembler::assemble() or \Drupal\Core\Routing\UrlGenerator::generateFromRoute() to generate the href attribute for this link, and also used when generating the link. Defaults to an empty array. It may contain the following elements:
options: Array of options for the select list for the filter.
options: Flags indicating how each row should be displayed. This contains:
options: Flags indicating how the summary should be displayed. This contains:
options: Optional, array of options for an optgroup.
options: The <option> element children.
options: The view plugin style options.
original: An associative array containing:
original: For updates, an array with source, alias and langcode with the previous values.
output: The processed output that will normally be used.
output_image_tag: Whether or not to output an <img> tag instead of a <picture> tag.
overridden: A boolean indicating the setting has been overridden from the default.

override preprocess functions: Set to TRUE when a theme does NOT want the standard preprocess functions to run. This can be used to give a theme FULL control over how variables are set. For example, if a theme wants total control over how certain variables in the page.html.twig are set, this can be set to true. Please keep in mind that when this is used by a theme, that theme becomes responsible for making sure necessary variables are set.
package: The name of the package of modules this module belongs to.
page.breadcrumb: Items for the breadcrumb region.
page.content: The main content of the current page.
page.footer: Items for the footer region.
page.header: Items for the header region.
page.help: Dynamic help text, mostly for admin pages.
page.highlighted: Items for the highlighted content region.
page.primary_menu: Items for the primary menu region.
page.secondary_menu: Items for the secondary menu region.
page.sidebar_first: Items for the first sidebar.
page.sidebar_second: Items for the second sidebar.
page: A render element representing the page.
page: Flag for the full page state.
page: Flag for the full page state. Will be true if view_mode is 'full'.
page: The rendered page markup.
page_bottom: Closing rendered markup. This variable should be printed after 'page'.
page_top: Initial rendered markup. This should be printed before 'page'.
pager: A render element containing:
pager: The optional pager next/prev links to display.
pages: List of pages, keyed by page number.
palette: Color fields that can be changed by entering in a new hex value.
parameters: Any extra GET parameters that should be retained, such as exposed input.
parameters: The parameters of the container.
parent: (optional) The machine name of the link that is this link's menu parent.

parent: A text string of parent comment submission information created from 'parent_author' and 'parent_created' during template_preprocess_comment(). This information is presented to help screen readers follow lengthy discussion threads. You can hide this from sighted users using the class visually-hidden.
parent: The machine name of the menu link that is the parent in the administrative hierarchy. See system.links.menu.yml to find the main skeleton of the hierarchy.

parent: The parent typed data object implementing either the ListInterface or the ComplexDataInterface if a property or list item is to be created. Otherwise, this should be set to NULL, but the key must be specified.
parent_author: Equivalent to author for the parent comment.
parent_changed: Equivalent to changed for the parent comment.
parent_created: Equivalent to created for the parent comment.
parent_permalink: Equivalent to permalink for the parent comment.
parent_title: Equivalent to title for the parent comment.
parent_title: Title of the parent node. Not printed by default. Provided as an option.
parent_url: URL to the parent node.
parents: An array of taxonomy term objects that are ancestors of the current term ID.
pass: The hashed account login password.
patch: Patch version (e.g., "0").
path('route', {'param': 'value'})
path('route', {'param': ['val1', 'val2'] }) // a sub-array
path('route', {'param1': 'value1', 'param2': 'value2'})

path: Override the path of the file to be used. Ordinarily the module or theme path will be used, but if the file will not be in the default path, include it here. This path should be relative to the Drupal root directory.
path: The path component of $url. If $url is an external URL, this includes the scheme, authority, and path.
path: The path to the template file to use. Defaults to the subdirectory 'templates' of the path of the extension implementing hook_theme(); e.g., 'core/modules/node/templates' for Node module.

path: The {block} in the path is a placeholder, which (for an entity) must always take the form of {machine_name_of_entity_type}. In the URL, the placeholder value will be the ID of an entity item. When the route is used, the entity system will load the corresponding entity item and pass it in as an object to the controller for the route.

pattern: A regular expression pattern to be used to allow this theme implementation to have a dynamic name. The convention is to use __ to differentiate the dynamic portion of the theme. For example, to allow forums to be themed individually, the pattern might be: 'forum__'. Then, when the forum is rendered, following render array can be used:
pending: An array of all the pending updates for the module including the description from source code comment for each update function. This array is keyed by the update name.

pending: An array of all the pending updates for the module including the update number and the description from source code comment for each update function. This array is keyed by the update number.
percent: The percentage of the progress.
permalink: Comment permalink.
pid (int): Unique path alias identifier.
placeholder_token: The token for generating head, css, js and js-bottom placeholders.
plugin_id: Plugin the search results came from.
plugin_id: The ID of the block implementation.
plugin_id: The machine-readable name of the plugin being executed,such as "node_search" or "user_search".
plugins: A list of plugins.
plural: The string for the plural case.
prefix: (optional) The form element prefix, may not be set.
prefix: The base theme engine prefix.
prefix: The content to add before the <fieldset> children.

preprocess functions: A list of functions used to preprocess this data. Ordinarily this won't be used; it's automatically filled in. By default, for a module this will be filled in as template_preprocess_HOOK. For a theme this will be filled in as twig_preprocess and twig_preprocess_HOOK as well as themename_preprocess and themename_preprocess_HOOK.
preprocess: An array of theme variable preprocess callbacks to invoke before invoking final theme variable processors.
prev_title: Title of the previous node.
prev_url: URL to the previous node.
prevent: A JavaScript event to prevent when the event is triggered. For example, if you use event 'mousedown' on a button, you might want to prevent 'click' events from also being triggered.
preview: An associative array containing:
preview: When previewing a new or edited comment.
previous: Item for the previous page; not present on the first page of results.
previous: Present if the currently visible list of pages does not start at the first page.
primary: HTML list items representing primary tasks.
priority: An integer denoting the priority of the handler. Defaults to 0.
process: An array of theme variable process callbacks to invoke before invoking the actual theme function or template.
progress: An array indicating how to show Ajax processing progress. Can contain one or more of these elements:

progress_message: Message displayed while processing the batch. Available placeholders are @current, @remaining, @total, @percentage, @estimate and @elapsed. Defaults to t('Completed @current of @total.').

progressive: A Boolean that indicates whether or not the batch needs to run progressively. TRUE indicates that the batch will run in more than one run. FALSE (default) indicates that the batch will finish in a single run.

project: (optional) Project shortname, recommended to ensure uniqueness, if the module is part of a project hosted on drupal.org. If omitted, also omit the : that follows. The project name is currently ignored by Drupal core but is used for automated testing.
project: An array of information about the project.
project: The canonical project short name.
project_types: A list of project types.
property: The name of the property to instantiate, or the delta of the the list item to instantiate.
provider: The module or other provider that provided this block plugin.
provider: The route grouping that is being dumped. All existing routes with this provider will be deleted on dump.
query: An array of query parameters from $url, if they exist.
query: An array of rows suitable for '#type' => 'table', containing information about the query and the display title and path.
queue: An override of the default queue (with name and class fields optional). An array containing two elements:
queue_default: The container service to use by default for queues without overrides. This defaults to 'queue.database'.
queue_reliable_service_$name: The container service to use for the reliable queue $name.
queue_service_$name: The container service to use for the queue $name.

quickedit: currently only contains one subkey 'editor' which indicates which in-place editor should be used. Possible values are 'form', 'plain_text', 'disabled' or another in-place editor other than the ones Quick Edit module provides.
random: If the rotation angle is randomized.
raw: The raw data for the field, if it exists. This is NOT output safe.
readmore: Flag for more state. Will be true if the teaser content of the node cannot hold the main body content.
reason: The reason you should update the project.
region: The name of the region variable as defined in the theme's .info.yml file.
regions: Listed regions.
release_link: The URL for the release notes.
remainder: Any non-tray, non-tab elements left to be rendered.
remember: A checkbox to remember selected filter value(s) (per user).
remote: If the library is a third-party script, this provides the repository URL for reference.
render element: A string denoting the name of the variable name, in which the render element for this theme hook is provided.

render element: Used for render element items only: the name of the renderable element or element tree to pass to the theme function. This name is used as the name of the variable that holds the renderable element or tree in preprocess and process functions.
render: Contains cached HTML strings like cached pages and blocks, can grow to large size.
render: The name of the class that is used to render the entities. The class must implement \Drupal\Core\Entity\EntityViewBuilderInterface.
rendered: The render array for the original image.
rendered: The rendered derivative image.

replace: (optional) A character to replace disallowed characters in the machine name via JavaScript. Defaults to '_' (underscore). When using a different character, 'replace_pattern' needs to be set accordingly.
replace_pattern: (optional) A regular expression (without delimiters) matching disallowed characters in the machine name. Defaults to '[^a-z0-9_]+'.
require_all_groups_for_translation: (optional) Set to TRUE to enforce that making this column group translatable requires all others to be translatable too.
required: (optional) A boolean indicating if this argument should be provided or not. Defaults to TRUE.
required: (optional) Whether the context definition is required.
required: A checkbox to require this filter or not.
required: An indicator for whether the associated form element is required.
required: An indicator for whether the textarea is required.
required: Boolean indicating if at least one handler service is required. Defaults to FALSE.
required: Boolean indicating whether the <fieldeset> element is required.
required: The required marker, or empty if the associated form element is not required.
required_by: A list of modules that require this module.
required_by: An array with the keys being the modules that will not work without this module.
requirements: An array of requirements/status items. Each requirement is an associative array containing the following elements:
requirements: Contains multiple requirement instances. Each requirement contains:
requires: A list of modules that this module requires.
requires: An array with the keys being the modules that this module requires.
resizable: An indicator for whether the textarea is resizable.
resource $context: Refer to http://php.net/manual/ref.stream.php
responsive: A flag indicating whether table is responsive.
responsive_image: A collection of responsive image data.
responsive_image_style_id: A responsive image style.
responsive_image_style_id: The \Drupal\responsive_image\Entity\ResponsiveImageStyle ID.
responsive_image_style_id: The ID of the responsive image style.
result: Individual search result.

return: Depending on the type of query, different return values may be meaningful. This directive instructs the system which type of return value is desired. The system will generally set the correct value automatically, so it is extremely rare that a module developer will ever need to specify this value. Setting it incorrectly will likely lead to unpredictable results or fatal errors. Legal values include:
return_as_object: A Boolean value whether to return a FormattedDateDiff object.

revision: (optional) The name of the property that contains the revision ID of the entity. The Field API assumes that all revision IDs are unique across all entities of a type. If this entry is omitted the entities of this type are not revisionable.
root_path: The root path of the current page (e.g., node, admin, user).
route_name: (optional) The route name to be used to build the path. Either the route_name or url element must be provided.
route_name: The route name for the current page used to collect the local tasks.
route_name: The route name of the link.
route_name: The route name to link to.
route_name: The route_name of the contextual link to be displayed
route_names: An array of all route names used in the subtree.
route_names: An array of all route names used in the tree.
route_parameters: (optional) The route parameters to build the path.
route_parameters: The route parameters for the contextual link.
route_parameters: The route parameters of the link.

route_provider: (optional) A list of class names, keyed by a group string, which will be used to define routes related to this entity type. These classes must implement \Drupal\Core\Entity\Routing\EntityRouteProviderInterface.
row: An array containing information about the current row.
row: Object representing the raw result of the SQL query for the current field.
row: The raw result from the query, with all data it fetched.
row: The raw result of the database query that generated this field.
row: The raw results rows.
row_class_default: A flag indicating whether default classes should be used on rows.
rows: A list of rows for this list.
rows: A list of the view's row items.
rows: An array of row items. Each row is an array of content.
rows: An array of table rows. Every row is an array of cells, or an associative array with the following keys:
rows: Table row items. Rows are keyed by row number.
rows: Table rows. Each row contains the following properties:
rows: The raw row data.
rows: The rendered view results.
rows: The results of the view query, if any.
rows: The rows contained in this view.
rows: The rows contained in this view. Each row contains:
rows: The rows returned from the view.
run: A constant representing the manner in which the task will be run. This parameter has three possible values:
runtime: The runtime requirements are being checked and shown on the status report page.
safe: Boolean indicating whether the message string has been marked as safe. Non-safe strings will be escaped automatically.
scheme: A color scheme form element. For example: a select element with color theme presets, or a color picker widget.

score: (required) The part of a query string to calculate the score for the ranking mechanism based on values in the database. This does not need to be wrapped in parentheses, as it will be done automatically; it also does not need to take the weighted system into account, as it will be done automatically. It does, however, need to calculate a decimal between 0 and 1; be careful not to cast the entire score to an integer by inadvertently introducing a variable argument.
screenshot: A screenshot representing the theme.
screenshot: Path to screenshot relative to the theme's .info.yml file.
script: To load JavaScript.
scripts: An associative array of JavaScripts, using the filename as key and the complete filepath as value. Not set if no scripts are defined in the .info.yml file.
scripts: Theme scripts.
secondary: HTML list items representing primary tasks.
secret: A cryptographically hard to guess secret string.
section: The section name of a View (e.g. title, rows or pager).
selected: A boolean that indicates whether the option is selected when rendered.
separator: A separator between each row.
separator: A string to be placed between inline fields to keep them visually distinct.
separator: An optional separator that may appear before a field.
service_id: name of service
services: The service definitions of the container.

set_active_class: (optional) Whether each link should compare the route_name + route_parameters or href (path), language and query options to the current URL, to determine whether the link is "active". If so, an "active" class will be applied to the list item containing the link, as well as the link itself. It is important to use this sparingly since it is usually unnecessary and requires extra processing. For anonymous users, the "active" class will be calculated on the server, because most sites serve each anonymous user the same cached page anyway. For authenticated users, the "active" class will be calculated on the client (through JavaScript), only data- attributes are added to list items and contained links, to prevent breaking the render cache. The JavaScript is added in system_page_attachments().
settings: (array) Settings for the plugin specified above. The default settings for the plugin will be used for settings left unspecified.
settings: (array) Settings specific to the formatter. Defaults to the formatter's default settings.
settings_links: A list of links for this setting.
settings_links: An array of links for this setting.
severity: (optional) The requirement's result/severity level, one of:
severity: The requirement's result/severity level, one of:
severity_status: Indicates the severity status.
severity_title: The title of the severity.
show: A flag indicating if the block should be displayed.
singular: The string for the singular case.
site_logo: Logo for site as defined in Appearance or theme settings.
site_name: Name for site as defined in Site information settings.
site_slogan: Slogan for site as defined in Site information settings.
size: Optional. The number of indentations to create.
sizes: The sizes attribute for viewport-based selection of images.
slogan: The slogan of the site.
snippet: A small preview of the result. Does not apply to user searches.
sort: A default sort order for this column ("asc" or "desc"). Only one column should be given a default sort order because table sorting only applies to one column at a time.
sort: Default sort order for this column ("asc" or "desc").
sortby: One of the following integers indicating the sort criteria:
source (string): The internal system path with a starting slash.

source: (optional) The #array_parents of the form element containing the human-readable name (i.e., as contained in the $form structure) to use as source for the machine name. Defaults to array('label').
source: The source of the translation.
sources: The attributes of the <source> tags for this <picture> tag.
speed: The effect speed to use (used with 'effect' and 'wrapper'). Valid options are 'slow' (default), 'fast', or the number of milliseconds the effect should run.
src: Full URL or relative path to the image file.
srcset: Array of multiple URIs and sizes/multipliers.
standalone: (optional) Whether the live preview should stay in its own form element rather than in the suffix of the source element. Defaults to FALSE.
start: The starting update that is to be processed. If this does not exist then do not process any updates for this module as there are other requirements that need to be resolved.
state: State of the theme group, e.g. installed or uninstalled.
statistics: An array of rows suitable for '#type' => 'table', containing performance statistics.
